account.content: A kind of basic object in distributed ledger used to keep the balance and other information of users.

address.content: A label consists of string of letters and numbers that anonymously represents user's identity on chain.

asset.content: A piece of data that has value or that represents an entity having value.

block.content: A grouping of transactions, marked with a timestamp, and a fingerprint of the previous block.

block height.content: Block height is the total number of blocks that have been confirmed on the blockchain, also used to identify a unique block when specifying a particular block height, as there is always an exact block at any block height.

block propagation.content: The process of synchronizing a new block to the majority of full nodes in the network.

block reward.content: The amount of cryptocurrency credited to a miner's account after the miner successfully adds a block of transactions to the blockchain.

blockchain.content: A data structure maintaining a growing list of records, organized as a chain of blocks.

bls signature.content: A cryptographic signature scheme for signing and verification.

broadcast.content: Blocks are sent to all nodes in a blockchain network.

capacity.content: The maximum space (in bytes) that a Cell can occupy on the Nervos CKB.

cell.content: Cells are the primary state units in CKB, within them users can include arbitrary states.

cell model.content: A representation of how state is managed on Nervos CKB.

censorship resistance.content: Censorship resistance in blockchain generally means that it is difficult for a malicious party to prevent the blockchain from confirming a set of transactions generated by honest users.

ckb.content: An abbreviation which can have different meanings depending on the context:.

ckbyte.content: A shorthand name for Common Knowledge Byte.

ckb-vm.content: CKB-VM is a crypto-agnostic virtual machine, a RISC-V instruction set based VM for executing both on-chain and off-chain code.

code hash.content: A field in a Cell that contains a hash value which could refer to a specific piece of data, or a specific Cell referenced by Type ID.

cold storage.content: A method of securing funds by placing them in a cold wallet; a type of wallet that is never connected to the internet.

cold wallet.content: A wallet that is used to secure assets offline.

commit.content: The process of taking a proposed transaction and adding it to the blockchain.

commit-chain.content: A scheme that enables the off-chain processing of transactions by one or more operators with on-chain state update commitments that do not contain per-transaction data.

commit reward.content: A reward paid to miners in CKBytes for committing a previously proposed transaction.

common knowledge base.content: A layer 1 proof of work blockchain that provides a foundation of decentralized trust for the Nervos Network.

common knowledge byte.content: The native token of the Nervos layer 1 blockchain, the Common Knowledge Base.

confirmation.content: A process where a transaction has been accepted and verified by the network and included in a block.

consensus.content: An algorithm executed among a number of distributed participants, ensuring that all participants faithfully executing this algorithm can reach agreement on some data value even if the other participants are faulty or malicious.

consume.content: The process of using a Live Cell as an input to a transaction.

contract account.content: An account containing code that executes automatically whenever it receives an event from another account.

cryptocurrency.content: A cryptocurrency is a digital or virtual currency that is secured by blockchain and cryptography, which makes it nearly impossible to counterfeit or double-spend.

cryptographic signature.content: A concise piece of proof data.

cryptography.content: Cryptography is the practice and study of techniques for secure communication in the presence of adversarial behavior.

cycles.content: The number of RISC-V computational cycles required by a Script to execute.

dao.content: A decentralized autonomous organization (DAO) is an organization represented by rules encoded as a computer program that is transparent, controlled by the organization members and not influenced by a centralized entity, in other words they are member-owned communities without centralized leadership.

data.content: In Nervos specific contexts, data may refer to the data structure within a Cell.

decentralization.content: In blockchain, decentralization refers to the transfer of control and decision-making from a centralized entity (individual, organization, or group thereof) to a distributed network.

defi.content: Short for "decentralized finance", a broad category of dApps aiming to provide financial services backed by the blockchain, without any intermediaries, so anyone with an internet connection can participate.

digital asset.content: A digital asset is an individual piece of data that has value, or represents another entity that has value.

digital currency.content: A type of currency that primarily exists digitally over the internet.

distributed.content: A system where components are spread across multiple nodes to parallelize workloads, add redundancy, or eliminate single points of failure.

digital object (dob).content: A non-fungible encrypted asset with its content fully stored on-chain, establishing an intrinsic link between content and value.

double-spending.content: Double-spending is the risk that a digital token is spent twice or more.

epoch.content: An epoch is a period of time for a set of blocks.

fee.content: The sender of a transaction often includes a fee to the network for processing the requested transaction.

fee rate.content: A tip per byte that a user offers to the miners for including his transaction in a block on the blockchain.

fork.content: A change in protocol causing the creation of an alternative chain, or a temporal divergence in two potential block paths during mining.

full node.content: A full node is an essential component of the CKB network.

full payload format.content: The deprecated full payload format directly encodes all data field of Lock Script.

fungible token.content: A fungible token can be fiat currencies like the dollar or a cryptocurrency like Bitcoin.

gas limit.content: The maximum amount of gas a transaction or block may consume.

hard-fork.content: A permanent divergence in the blockchain; also known as a hard-forking change.

hardware wallet.content: A hardware wallet is a form of cold wallet.

hash.content: A fixed-length fingerprint of variable-size input, produced by a hash function.

hash rate.content: Hash rate is a measure of the computational power per second used when mining.

height.content: A shorthand name for block height.

light client.content: As a low-resource node, a light client allows users to sync with a blockchain in a cryptographically secure manner without having to store the whole blockchain.

light node.content: A light node downloads only the headers of the blockchain, conserving resources.

metadata.content: Metadata is data that provides information about other data.

micro-state.content: A small piece of state that is isolated and often able to be acted upon independently without knowing the total state of the network.

miner.content: A network node that finds valid proof of work for new blocks, by repeated hashing.

mining.content: Mining is the process by which a blockchain node get new token reward by verifying new transactions, finding valid proof of work and creating new blocks.

mining node.content: Mining nodes create new blocks by solving computational puzzles.

mining reward.content: Native tokens paid to miners as a reward for providing the necessary computing resources for mining.

multisig.content: The term multisig stands for multi-signature, which is a specific type of digital signatures that can be created through the combination of multiple unique signatures.

native token.content: The token issued as reward to a blockchain's consensus nodes.

nc-max.content: Nervos CKB's consensus algorithm, which follows NC's backbone protocol.

neighbor.content: A node that is directly connected to another node in the blockchain peer to peer network.

nervos blockchain.content: The layer 1 blockchain of the Nervos Network known as the Common Knowledge Base.

nervos dao.content: Nervos DAO enable users to lock CKBytes to get compensation from Nervos CKB secondary issuance.

network hash rate.content: A measurement of the total computational processing power which is dedicated to providing security to the network.

node.content: A software client that participates in the network.

nonce.content: In cryptography, a value that can only be used once.

non-fungible token.content: Non-fungible tokens or NFTs are cryptographic assets on a blockchain with unique identification codes and metadata that distinguish them from each other.

open source.content: A piece of software where source code is freely available for examination or alteration by any third-party.

p2p.content: A shortname name for peer to peer.

paper wallet.content: A form of storing a recovery phrase or private keys offline by printing them on a piece of paper.

payment address.content: A string of letters and numbers that cryptocurrency and assets can be sent to and from.

payment channel.content: A micropayment channel or payment channel is class of techniques designed to allow users to make multiple payment transactions without committing all of the transactions to the layer 1 blockchain.

peer to peer.content: A peer-to-peer (P2P) service is a decentralized platform whereby two individuals interact directly with each other, without intermediation by a third party.

private key.content: A private key, also known as a secret key, is a variable in cryptography, known only to the owner(s) of the key, that is used with an algorithm to encrypt and decrypt data.

proof of work.content: PoW asks users to solve a cryptographic puzzle to prove ownershipo of a certain amount of computational resource to participate in the consensus.

proof of stake.content: PoS asks users to prove ownership of a certain amount of cryptocurrency (their “stake” in the network) in order to be able to participate in the consensus.

propagation.content: A shorthand name for Block Propagation.

public key.content: A notion used only in public-key cryptography, a.k.a.

reward.content: An amount of CKBytes included in each new block as a reward by the network to the miner who found the proof-of-work solution.

signature.content: A shorthand name for cryptographic signature.

smart contract.content: A smart contract is a self-executing contract with the terms of the agreement between contract creators and contract users being directly written into lines of code.

state bloat.content: The unlimited increase of state data in Ethereum.

state channel.content: A layer 2 solution where a channel is set up between participants, where they can transact freely and cheaply.

tip.content: A shorthand name for tip block.

tip block.content: The most recent block to be confirmed in a blockchain.

transaction.content: Transaction is the basic object created and signed by users to interact with distributed ledger.

transaction fee.content: A fee which is paid in the native token to miners in exchange for processing a transaction.

token.content: A “token” often refers to non-native token on smart contract platform, such as UDT on Nervos Network or ERC20 on Ethereum.

turing complete.content: Turing Complete refers to a machine that, given enough time and memory along with the necessary instructions, can solve any computational problem, no matter how complex.

udt.content: Short for User-Defined Token, a customised token created with properties defined by the user.

unconfirmed.content: The state of a transaction that has not yet been confirmed.

unconfirmed transaction.content: A transaction that has not yet been confirmed.

user-defined token.content: A custom token created with properties defined by the user.

utxo.content: Abbreviated from Unspent Transaction Output, UTXO denotes the remaining amount of tokens after a transaction, available for future use.

wallet.content: User-facing software used to interact with on-chain entities such as assets, smart contracts and dApps.

base issuance.content: Base issuance is the basic CKByte issuance with a fixed and decreasing schedule.

base reward.content: Base reward is the block reward (in CKBytes) to miners generated from the base issuance.

economic abstraction.content: With proper tool support, users can use tokens other than CKByte (for example, stable coins) to pay transactions fees, a concept known as "Economic Abstraction".

fiat currency.content: Fiat currencies are a medium of exchange established as money, often by government regulation.

heavy asset problem.content: A common problem found in multi-asset blockchain platforms where the value of the assets stored on the chain gains significant value but the native token of the chain does not.

liquidity.content: The ability for an asset to be bought or sold easily without causing a significant change in the current market price.

proposal reward.content: A reward paid to miners in CKBytes for proposing an unconfirmed transaction.

secondary issuance.content: The creation of new CKBytes that is paid to miners through secondary rewards.

secondary reward.content: A subsidy paid to miners in CKBytes for providing the compute and storage requirements required for processing transactions and persisting data on Nervos.

selfish mining attack.content: Selfish mining is a concept that was addressed by Cornell University researchers in detail in a 2013 report.

starving layer 1 problem.content: A scenario that can arise in multi-layer blockchain platforms where the vast majority of the transaction traffic moves from layer 1 to layer 2, taking the vast majority of transaction fees with it.

state rent.content: A recurring fee that is paid to persist and secure state data.

store of assets.content: Similar to the concept of "Store of Value" in the context of Bitcoin, we call the utility "Store of Assets" when a blockchain keeps any crypto-assets securely and censorship-resistantly.

store of value.content: Assets which can maintain their worth over time without depreciating.

tail emission.content: A type of reward that is paid to miners through a fixed amount of inflation.

targeted inflation.content: A form of inflation that only affects a specific subset of users.

tragedy of the commons.content: A situation in a system where the participants act in accordance with their self-interest and deplete or destroy a shared resource through their collective action.

tragedy of the security commons.content: A situation that can emerge on multi-asset blockchain platforms where asset tokens rely on the storage and security of the blockchain platform, but do not contribute back to the platform.

tragedy of the storage commons.content: A situation that can emerge on incentivized blockchain platforms where mining rewards are paid for inclusion of data to the blockchain, but no rewards exist for the long-term persistence of the blockchain data.

active cell.content: Or Live Cell, a Cell exists in the current CKB state.

aggron.content: The first Nervos CKB Testnet corresponding to Mainnet Lina.

animagus.content: A framework layer that runs on top of Nervos CKB which provides an easy way to query for account balances without having to go through the Cell collection process.

axon.content: Axon is a chain-based layer 2 protocol and framework with a practical security and economic model.

block subsidy.content: A payment that is made in the native currency of the blockchain that is paid to miners for providing the computational resources create a block and secure the blockchain.

boxer.content: A lightweight Rust library for verifying the Nervos layer 1 blockchain, the Common Knowledge Base.

cell collection.content: The process of gathering Cells that meet certain criteria.

cellbase.content: The transaction in each block that is responsible for the minting of new CKBytes.

cellbase_maturity.content: Any referenced cellbase output must meet this requirement in a transaction; otherwise, the transaction is rejected.

cell_deps.content: Pointers to Live Cells on the chain that allow Scripts in the transaction to access (read-only) referenced Live Cells.

ckbhash.content: CKB uses blake2b as the default hash algorithm with the following configurations:.

ckb merkle tree.content: CKB Merkle Tree is a CBMT(  ) using following merge function:.

commitment zone.content: Section of the block that contains transaction commitments.

cpfp.content: Abbreviation of Child Pays For Parent.

crypto primitives.content: Well-established, low-level cryptographic algorithm commonly used to build out a cryptographic protocol.

dead cell.content: A Cell that has been used as an input to a previous transaction and is consumed.

dep group.content: A method for referencing multiple dependencies which are commonly used together using a single dependency field.

dep type.content: A field that specifies the type of the dependency.

dependencies.content: Dependencies are commonly referred to as deps.

duktape.content: Duktape is an embeddable JavaScript engine, with a focus on portability and compact footprint.

difficulty.content: A measurement of how difficult it is to solve the  cryptographic puzzle required to create a block.

diviner.content: A deterministic testing framework for Rust.

eaglesong.content: Eaglesong is a new hash function developed specifically for Nervos CKB proof-of-work, which is also suitable in other use cases in which a secure hash function is needed.

epoch_duration_target.content: The estimated epoch duration specified by NC-Max.

erc20.content: An Ethereum token standard for basic fungible tokens.

erc721.content: An Ethereum token standard for non-fungible tokens.

erc777.content: An updated Ethereum token standard for basic fungible tokens that is backwards compatible with ERC20.

erc1155.content: An Ethereum token standard that supports the creation any number of fungible or non-fungible tokens on a single contract.

fee bumping.content: A mechanism for users to increase the fee of a broadcasted transaction to accelerate confirmation, particularly useful during network congestion, or when the initial fee is too low.

full address.content: An address format used on Nervos that includes the full code hash of the Lock Script associated.

generator.content: A program used to create transactions that can be broadcast to the Nervos CKB network.

genesis block.content: The first block in the blockchain, used to initialize the global state.

godwoken.content: Godwoken is a layer 2 rollup framework for Nervos CKB.

governance script.content: A Type Script which defines the monetary policy of a User Defined Token (UDT).

governance script hash.content: A Blake2b hash of a Type Script which is used as an identifier for the Script when referenced by a Cell.

inbound connection.content: Inbound connection means it is initiated by the remote peer; and the connection itself is outgoing connection when we switch the subject to the remote peer.

indexer.content: An application or library to trace Live Cells that comply with criteria specified by the developer or user.

initial_primary_epoch_reward.content: Incentives paid to miners in CKBytes by epoch in CKB base issuance.

input.content: A Live Cell that is used in a transaction.

keyper.content: A specification of how to manage wallet Lock Scripts which apply to a specific user.

late spawning.content: When a node joins a blockchain network for the first time after the network has already been in operation for a period of time.

layer 1.content: Layer 1 of a decentralized ecosystem is the underlying blockchain architecture.

layer 2.content: Layer 2 refers to a secondary framework or protocol that is built on top of an existing blockchain system.

lina.content: The name of public Mainnet of the Nervos CKB.

live cell.content: A Cell that has not been consumed and is available for use.

lock.content: A Script that represents the ownership of a Cell.

lock script.content: A Script that enforces access and ownership of a Cell.

lock script hash.content: A  hash of a Lock Script which is used as an identifier for the Script when referenced by a Cell.

mainnet.content: Short for "main network", the running Nervos CKB public blockchain.

max_block_bytes.content: The maximum transaction size limit allowed in a block in bytes.

max_block_cycles.content: The maximum transaction cycle limit allowed in a block.

max_block_proposals_limit.content: The maximum amount of proposals contained in one block.

max_uncles_num.content: The maximum number (Uint64) of uncle blocks allowed for one block.

median_time_block_count.content: A timestamp is valid only when it is greater than the median timestamp of the previous 37 blocks.

minting.content: The process of creating of new tokens.

molecule.content: A serialization framework for encoding data widely used on the Nervos Network.

muta.content: A highly customizable, high-performance blockchain framework designed to support proof of stake, BFT consensus and smart contracts.

nervos ckb.content: The layer 1 blockchain of the Nervos Network, the Common Knowledge Base.

off-chain computation.content: A programming model where all computation is done off-chain to reduce the burden on the nodes in the network and provide higher levels of scalability.

off-chain scaling.content: Off-chain scaling is the approach that only using the blockchain as a secure asset and settlement platform in conjunction with transferring almost all transactions off the blockchain.

off-chain state.content: The data of an application that is not stored on the blockchain, or is not accessible by on-chain smart contracts.

on-chain computation.content: A programming model where all computation by smart contracts is done on-chain by every node on the network simultaneously.

on-chain scaling.content: On-chain scaling solution refer to extending the throughput of the consensus process, or increasing network throughput as node number increases.

on-chain state.content: The data of an application that is stored on the blockchain and is accessible by on-chain smart contracts.

on-chain verification.content: A programming model where all computation is done off-chain to reduce the burden on the nodes in the network, but verification of the resulting data is done on-chain to enforce the smart contract rules created by the developer.

open transaction.content: A signed piece of a transaction that is incomplete and invalid on its own.

optimistic rollup.content: A rollup of transactions that use fraud proofs to offer increased layer 2 transaction throughput while using the security and data availability provided by layer 1.

orphan.content: A shorthand name for Orphan Block.

orphan block.content: An orphan block is a valid block that is not included in the main fork due to, for example, a lag within the network itself.

orphan rate.content: A measure of the speed at which Orphan blocks occur within the blockchain network.

orphan_rate_target.content: The estimated orphan block rate specified in NC-max.

orphan transaction.content: An orphan transaction is one for which the parent transaction is absent at the time of its processing.

outpoint.content: A particular output Cell in a transaction.

output.content: A Live Cell that is created in a transaction.

overlord.content: A byzantine fault tolerant consensus algorithm designed by Nervos for Huobi which can support thousands of transactions per second.

p2wsh.content: A Pay-to-Witness-Script-Hash (P2WSH) is a type of Bitcoin transaction similar to a  transaction in most ways, except that it uses .

permanent_difficulty_in_dummy.content: Keeps the difficulty permanent if PoW is dummy when dev-chain disables NC-MAX difficulty adjustment.

polyjuice.content: Polyjuice provides an Ethereum compatible runtime on Godwoken.

primary_epoch_reward_halving_interval.content: The halving cycle of epoch reward in CKB base issuance, typically every four years.

proposal zone.content: Section of the block that contains transaction proposals.

propose.content: The process of taking an unconfirmed transaction out of the mempool and proposing it for commitment.

proposer_reward_ratio.content: The reward ratio from transaction fees for miners who submit proposals specified by NC-Max.

risc-v.content: An open standard instruction set architecture (ISA) for general computing.

schnorr signature.content: A cryptographic signature scheme for signing and verification.

script.content: A Script in Nervos CKB is a binary executable on the CKB-VM.

script_args.content: script_args refers to the arguments imported into the CKB-VM instance as input for the Scripts.

seed cell.content: A design pattern on Nervos from creating unique identifiers used to create unforgeable assets.

short address.content: An address format on Nervos that does not include a code hash of the associated Lock Script, instead using one of the many common Lock Scripts.

simple udt.content: A standard that defines the most basic implementation of a UDT fungible token on Nervos.

since.content: since is the u64 (unsigned 64-bit integer) field in transaction input for preventing inclusion before a certain block timestamp or a block number.

spv.content: An abbreviation for Simplified Payment Verification.

spv wallet.content: A light-weight cryptocurrency wallet that uses the SPV protocol.

testnet.content: Short for “test network,” a network used to simulate the behavior of the .

transaction confirmation number.content: The number of confirmations required for a transaction to be added to a block.

transaction hash.content: Transaction hash, or Txhash, is the unique identifier of a transaction in a blockchain that acts as a record or proof that the transaction has taken place.

transaction witness hash.content: Transaction witness hash is generated by the serialized transaction through ckbhash.

transaction root.content: The field transactions_root in header is.

tx_proposal_window.content: Interval for submitting proposals in the second stage specified by NC-Max.

type script.content: A Script that enforces the rules that must be followed in a transaction for a Cell to be consumed as an input or for a Cell to be created as an output.

type script hash.content: Or type_hash, a Blake2b hash of a Type Script which is used as an identifier for the Script when referenced by a Cell.

validator.content: A Script that is used to ensure that the transactions created by the generators are valid.

witness.content: A set of cryptographic proof containing the data required to prove authorization of the resources used in the transaction.

xudt.content: An extended UDT standard upon sUDT (Simple UDT) to accommodate additional functionalities, including regulatory compliance.

zk-snark.content: A form of cryptographic proof, that when used in cryptocurrencies, allows for privacy features which do not reveal the amounts or participants in transactions.

zk-stark.content: A form of cryptographic proof, that when used in cryptocurrencies, allows for privacy features which do not reveal the amounts or participants in transactions.
